> XXXXX FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 24 XXXXX
> =20
> =20
> Smash Friday
> =20
> Smash Friday is the new Black Friday. The day after Thanksgiving, the =
Smash Truck will pull up in front of Macy's Herald Square, and invite =
people into our polycarbonate-shielded smash enclosure to smash the =
living bejesus out of old toys, crockery, printers, appliances, and =
other smashables, to a soundtrack of thrash music, maybe some flaming =
brass, and the screams of encouragement from onlookers. Then we'll move =
on to Union Square and do the same. Is this some statement about =
politics or consumerism? Nah, not really, it's about the joy of =
smashing.
> =20
> Macy's Herald Square, usually the corner of 35th Street and 7th =
Avenue, Manhattan
> noon; $free
> =20
> Union Square West, at 15th Street, Manhattan
> 2:30p; $free
> =20
> =20
> ***** Also on FRIDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Future Femmes
> =20
> We Are the Future! is teaming up with OnlyFemmes for another art =
fair/art share and curated dance party at the Sultan Room. This =
interdisciplinary art fair/art share and curated dance party focused on =
bringing NYC's cutting-edge artists and creatives together to experience =
the intersections between multimedia practices, technology, =
sustainability and identity through their unique lenses. Join us for a =
sexy, all-night dance party featuring immersive art installations, DJs, =
live visuals, burlesque, art vendors, tarot card readings, body paint, =
and flash tattoos. With DJs Klipdagga, Vee, B=C3=91=C2=8Fee, J.N.R., and =
Senaida. Tarot readings by Techno Tarot. Flash tattoos by Liv. Clothing =
by Amor y Dinero. Herbal Treats by the Rooted Zodiac. We are dedicated =
to creating a safe and inclusive space for members of the BIPOC and =
LGBTQ+ community.
> =20
> The Sultan Room Rooftop
> 234 Starr Street, Brooklyn
> 11p-late; $10 presale, $15 door
> 21 and over
> https://link.dice.fm/ka900dbd6fa8
> =20
> =20
> ***** Also on FRIDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> =46rom the Skint:
> =20
> Hanksgiving
> =20
> Come celebrate the Owl Music Parlor=E2=80=99s fifth annual =
Hanksgiving, honoring the music of Hank Williams and, this year, his =
100th birthday. Featuring the house band: Jared Engel (upright bass), =
Sam Talmadge (steel), Wyndham Baird (acoustic guitar), and Minnie Jordan =
(fiddle). And special guest singers Ali Dineen, Gustavo Rodriguez, =
Charlie Burnham, and Feral Foster.  With hosts Rachel Swaner and Oren =
Bloedow. With pumpkin pie after the show.
> =20
> The Owl Music Parlor
> 497 Rogers Avenue, Brooklyn
> 7:30p doors, 8p show; $15 suggested donation
> https://theowl.nyc/calendar/
> =20
> =20
> XXXXX SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 25 XXXXX
> =20
> =20
> Joke-e-oke: Standup Comedy Karaoke Game Show
> =20
> Joke-e-oke is karaoke with standup comedy material, where the audience =
gets to be the stars in a three-round game show. Five contestants pick a =
classic standup comedy routine, and all the material is right there on =
the monitor. Three celebrity comedian judges rate their performances to =
determine the Joke-e-oke Champ. Hosted Harmon Leon.
> =20
> Young Ethels
> 506 5th Avenue, Brooklyn
> 5p; $free
> =
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/joke-e-oke-standup-comedy-karaoke-tickets-757=
877922267
> =20
> =20
> ***** Also on SATURDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Tinder Live
> =20
> Tinder Live with Lane Moore is the critically acclaimed comedy show =
where Moore projects her dating app onto a screen, swipes through =
profiles live on stage, and the audience votes whether she swipes right =
or left, to cathartic, hilarious, and surprisingly kind results. With =
Mike Drucker and Jill Twiss.
> =20
> TV Eye
> 1647 Weirfield Street, Ridgewood, Queens
> 7p doors, 8p show; $20-25
> https://wl.seetickets.us/event/tinder-live-with-lane-moore/573124
> =20
> =20
> XXXXX SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 26 XXXXX
> =20
> =20
> Reverend Billy and the Stop Shopping Choir in Welcome to the =
Earthchxrch
> =20
> Each holiday season, Reverend Billy and the Stop Shopping Choir =
revisit Joe's Pub with a new hour of rousing, moving, and then comic =
songs and sermonettes on the theme of activism in defense of the Earth. =
Designer and director is Savitri D.
> =20
> Performances of Reverend Billy and the Stop Shopping Choir combine =
activism and highly responsive entertainment. They are constantly =
changing and include songs, rituals, audience testimonials, and a =
15-minute comic-then-serious sermon by Bill Talen as the energetic, =
charismatic revivalist preacher Reverend Billy. Each show is different =
but all are motivated by a profound imperative: to strengthen individual =
connection to the Earth, to develop pathways to social change and to =
hold financial institutions and policy makers accountable for their role =
in the Climate Crisis.
> =20
> Joe's Pub
> 425 Lafayette Street, Manhattan
> 6p; $15 plus 2 drink or 1 food item minimum, per person.
> Continues December 10 and December 17
> savitri@revbilly.com
> https://publictheater.org
> https://revbilly.com
> =20
> =20
> XXXXX MONDAY, NOVEMBER 27 XXXXX
> =20
> =20
> Lonely Artists Salon
> =20
> The Lonely Artists Salon, a space for artists to be artists, not =
necessarily to make art. For all the disillusioned young performers in =
NYC who are tired of having to pay or to wait for permission to do the =
things they love, this salon meets every other Monday to offer young =
performers of all disciplines the chance to present work, hear work from =
others, provide feedback and play fun theater games. We=E2=80=99re =
always excited to meet more people.
> =20
> Lonely Artist Salon
> Producers Club Studio 1
> 358 West 44th Street, Manhattan
> 8:30-10:30p; $free
> =
https://www.instagram.com/reel/Cz6h5VSOF2p/?utm_source=3Dig_web_copy_link&=
igshid=3DMzRlODBiNWFlZA=3D=3D
> =20
> =20
> ***** Also on MONDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Hyperfocus: A Neurodivergent Comedy Show
> =20
> Hyperfocus is a first-class ticket into the inner workings of a =
neurodivergent brain. Come see NYC's best neurodivergent comedians share =
the wealth of their super niche knowledge. Previous topics included =
Fermentation, Do We Need Another Wonka Reboot? and the JFK =
Assassination. What will they hyperfocus on next? Featuring: Ronald =
Metellus, Dan Wickes, Blaise Vacca, and Rachel Kenaston. Hosted by =
Virginia Dickens.
> =20
> Caveat
> 21A Clinton Street, Manhattan
> 9:30p PM, doors at 9 PM
> Tickets: $20 standard/door
> $10 livestream
> https://www.caveat.nyc/events/hyperfocus-11-27-2023
> =20
> =20
> XXXXX TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 28 XXXXX
> =20
> =20
> Sounds Great
> =20
> The comedy show you've grown to love is celebrating five years this =
month. It's a big five-year-old party, full of Sounds Greats past and =
present, and filled with some of our favorite comedians from the past =
five years. Join Nora and Paige as they run through all the moments that =
have prompted them to say =E2=80=9Csounds great," and there will be =
cake! This month's show will once again feature our signature mix of =
both rising and established performers, with a priority on queer and =
diverse points of view. The November anniversary show features: Alison =
Leiby, Brittany Carney, Dash Turner, Indigo Asim, Art Cai, Rebecca =
Weiser, Ryan Ciewiz, and James Wendt. Hosted by Nora Jefferies and Paige =
Smith-Hogan.
> =20

> 153 Morgan Avenue, Brooklyn
> 7:30p; $free with RSVP
> https://link.dice.fm/dafef79de8c5

> Gl'Amour!
> =20
> The gorgeous Love Show dancers come high kicking into the Slipper Room =
every last Wednesday of the month, bringing a little Paris, a little =
Vegas, and a lot of NYC heart. Come for stunning dance, burlesque, =
cabaret, live song and variety, and leave full of love and glimmer.

> 167 Orchard Street, Manhattan

> Rhythm and Reset
> =20
> Rhythm and Reset is a brand-new music event series presented in =
partnership by Sound Mind Live and House of Yes. Unlock the magic with =
lasting community connection, soulful jams, a beautiful setting and =
intimate musical showcases by Death by Comet, Natie and Dani Sundream.

> 8 Wyckoff Avenue, Brooklyn
> 7p; $5

> ***** Also on WEDNESDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> The Brick Presents: Slash
> =20
> Betty and Veronica have tried everything to cure their crippling =
depression and existential despair. Everything, that is, except acting =
out homoerotic fanfiction.
> =20
> Cue a Russian doll of stories slashing John Lennon x Paul McCartney, =
Susan Sontag x Camille Paglia, Trotsky x Stalin, Byron x Shelley, and =
Kirk x Spock.
> =20
> As the layers of fantasy multiply, the girls are left questioning what =
really drives their games, and to what end.
> =20
> Slash is a two-woman comedy written, adapted, directed, and performed =
by Emily Allan and Leah Hennessey.
> =20
> The Brick
> 579 Metropolitan Avenue, Brooklyn
> 8p; $10
> Continues through December 2
> https://www.bricktheater.com/event/slash/2023-11-29/
> =20
> =20
> XXXXX THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 30 XXXXX
> =20
> =20
> Protocinema
> =20
> A celebration of the wonderful and weird world of short films. =
Protocinema is a live screening of short film and video works from =
unknown or emerging directors. The program will highlight works that are =
evocative, eclectic, experimental, low budget/DIY, innovative, and ask =
more questions than they answer.
> =20
> Protocinema maintains that shorts are a democratic medium for =
everyone, not just filmmakers, and are a unique entity separate from the =
traditional feature length studio film.
> =20
> Shapeshifter Lab (Park Slope)
> 837 Union Street, Brooklyn
> 6:30p doors; $free, pay what you want
> filmfreeway.com/protocinema
> =20
> =20
> ***** Also on THURSDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> American History Sex
> =20
> How would James Madison do on Tinder? Which president had the best =
dying words? Did the Union troops write the original diss track? All of =
this and more with comedian, history lover, and self-lover Bobby =
Sheehan.
> =20
> Q.E.D.
> 27-16 23rd Avenue, Astoria, Queens
> 7:30p; $10

> Boxcutter Cabaret
> =20
> The Boxcutter Cabaret is an evening of short puppet shows curated by =
the Boxcutter Collective. Our special guests this month are =
Brooklyn/Montreal-based Chilean duo Teatro Ji, presenting the NYC =
premiere of their new cantastoria, You Choose: A Speculative Spectacle. =
This show is supported in part by the Puppet Slam Network.
> =20
> Earth Chxrch

> 6:30p doors, 7p show; $20 suggested donation
> boxcuttercollective.org
> =20

> ***** Also on THURSDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Cryptochrome
> =20
> Cryptochrome is a sonic odyssey across the animal kingdom that invites =
audiences to imagine themselves in the sensory worlds of other living =
things. Named after a protein believed to be responsible for the ability =
to navigate using the Earth=E2=80=99s geomagnetic field, cryptochrome =
explores realms of perception beyond the visible. Written, directed, =
composed, and performed by Evan Silver aka Tiresias. Music direction by =
Tristan Allen.
> =20
> The Cell
> 338 23rd Street, Manhattan
> 8p; $20-30
> continues through December 9
> https://www.tickettailor.com/events/thecelltheatre/1023532
> =20
> =20
> XXXXX FRIDAY, DECEMBER 1 XXXXX
> =20
> =20
> Power Suit
> =20
> Half comedy show, half Goop board meeting. Power Suit is a comedy =
cabaret devoted to #GirlBoss culture. Join hosts, Mariah Oxley and =
Rebecca Weiser, for an evening of comedy, music, and drag performances =
inspired by famed Girl Bosses Gwyneth Paltrow and Elizabeth Holmes. Come =
laugh and commit light financial fraud. This month=E2=80=99s show =
features Indigo Asim, Francesca D'Uva, Alexa Loftus, and Mary Beth =
Barone.
> =20
> Club Cumming
> 505 East 6th Street, Manhattan
> 7:30p doors, 8p show; $12.35 advance, $15 door

> =20
> =20
> What have you been wishing for? Collaborators, grant monies, a new =
home? Please send brief listings to jstark@nonsensenyc.com. In the =
SPACES section we only list available apartments, lofts, studios, and =
one-off rentals -- not spaces wanted.

> =20
> ***** ARTY STUFF *****
> =20
> =20
> * Are You Gregnant? Do you know someone who is Gregnant? (Pregnant by =
a person named Greg?) Great, send them my way! Please help me in my =
quest to find all of the amazing Gregnant women in the greater NYC area. =
If I can find enough of us, I plan to throw the first-ever =
all-Gregnant-party. There will be dancing, tomfoolery, pregnancy =
burlesque shows, belly painting, and all sorts of mischief for this =
special selection of people. If you are Gregnant, please fill out this =
form: www.gregnant.mom or email glittermilkpresents@gmail.com. =
https://www.instagram.com/glitterr.milk/
> =20
> =20
> XXXXX SPECTRE PRIORITY XXXXX
> =20
> =20
> Before it had a name, Spectre Event Horizon Group used to meet at a =
bar to commiserate and grok the increasingly sci-fi present. Along the =
way #SPECTRE developed an online platform for sharing specialized =
investigative research, presented as gossip for non-specialists, all =
searchable here: spectrevision.net. Excerpts are compiled for Nonsense =
by J. Sinopoli. Please recommend relevant search terms or search results =
to spectre.event.horizon.group]at]gmail.com.
> =20
> =20
> ***** Pirate Abolitionists *****
> =20
> https://spectrevision.net/2023/11/21/pirate-abolitionists/
> =20
> "Not only did the infamous pirates wreak millions in damages, but they =
sowed havoc among the human traffickers along the coast, burning and =
exploding their ships and ports, bringing the trade nearly to a =
standstill. Once these pirates had been caught and 'summarily dealt =
with,' Britain=E2=80=99s Royal African Company was able to rebuild their =
horrific trade, allowing the newer British model of chattel slavery to =
become the predominant form of enslavement in the U.S."
> =20
> =20
> XXXXX LEARNING XXXXX
> =20
> =20
> Learning is something you do, but it=E2=80=99s also a reflection of =
who you=E2=80=99d like to be. We like to be cheap and eclectic, with a =
mix of classes or events that will make our world a little bigger and =
more interesting. Who do you want to be? Maybe it's in here.
> =20
> One-time listings are categorized weekly, with general recurring =
classes listed at the end on the first Friday of each month.
> =20
> Learning is compiled and edited weekly by Corinne Brenner. Please send =
listing suggestions to learning]at]nonsensenyc.com.
> =20
> =20
> ***** LEARNING: SATURDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Introduction to Birdwatching Outings
> =20
> Whether you=E2=80=99re just starting out or have already joined the =
birding ranks, this introductory outings is for you. Every Saturday, =
join Prospect Park Alliance and a member of the Brooklyn Bird Club on an =
introductory walk to learn the basics of birding and search for the =
dozens of species that visit Prospect Park through all seasons.
> =20
> All levels are welcome and walks will begin at the Prospect Park =
Audubon Center. No registration necessary. Children under 12 must be =
accompanied by an adult. Please bring binoculars if you have them.
> =20
> Route Description: This outing is at a leisurely pace with lots of =
stops to observe birds. A different route through the park may be taken =
each week. There may be steps, slight inclines, and grass and dirt paths =
with exposed roots. We will cover approximately 1.5-2 miles.
> =20
> Brooklyn Bird Club
> Audubon Center, Prospect Park near Lincoln Drive entrance, Brooklyn
> 10a-noon; $free
> =
prospectpark.org/event/introduction-to-birdwatching-outings/2023-11-25/
> =20
> =20
> ***** LEARNING: SATURDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Lingerie Making Workshop
> =20
> Design and sew a made-to-measure bralette with Rue du Paradis, a =
bespoke, high-end lingerie brand.
> =20
> Receive a custom pattern to your measurements. Select a lace and band =
from the lace bar. Sew your own bespoke bralette with step-by-step =
instructions. An unmissable four-hour experience. No sewing experience =
needed. Workshops are held Thursday through Sunday.
> =20
> Rue du Paradis
> Building 5, Industry City, 51 35th Street, Brooklyn
> 10:30a-2:30p; $150
> industrycity.com/event/rue-du-paradis-lingerie-making-workshop-23/
> =20
> =20
> ***** LEARNING: SATURDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Radical History Walking Tour
> =20
> Museum of Reclaimed Urban Space organic historian Bill Weinberg =
reveals the stories behind squats, gardens, riots, uprisings and more. =
=46rom the Civil War Draft Riots of the 1860s to the Young Lords, Black =
Panthers, hippies, Yippies and Up Against the Wall Motherf*ckers of the =
1960s, to the Tompkins Square anarchists of the =E2=80=9980s, to the =
tree-hugging urban enviros of the =E2=80=9990s to the neighborhood =
Earthies keeping the legacy alive today. Unlike other neighborhood =
tours, we broaden beyond individual anecdotes to paint a strong =
historical, academic, and cultural big picture of the Lower East Side.
> =20
> Five things you will learn on the Lower East Side Radical History Tour =
that you probably didn=E2=80=99t know:
> =20
> 1. The radical politics of the songwriter who penned the =E2=80=9CWizard=
 of Oz=E2=80=9D soundtrack. 2. What building in the East Village links =
the Gershwin brothers, the Black Panthers, and Iggy Pop. 3. What park in =
the East Village was the secret birthplace of both the Hare Krishna =
movement and Occupy Wall Street. 4. How New York City=E2=80=99s =
recycling program began as an initiative of East Village community =
activists. 5. Why the same area of the city has been variously known as =
Burnt Mill Point, Drydock, Little Germany, Klein Deutschland, the Lower =
East Side, Loisaida, the East Village, and Alphabet City. Tours need =
three people to run, and almost always do.
> =20
> Museum of Reclaimed Urban Space
> 155 Avenue C, between 9th and 10th streets, Manhattan
> 3-5p; $20
> morusnyc.org/radical-history-tour/
> =20
> =20
> ***** LEARNING: MONDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Sound 101 for Everyone
> =20
> This class is to give anyone who works with and around sound a solid =
understanding of the fundamental principles of SOUND. We will look at =
everything from acoustic theory, dsp, how hardware works, useful =
software, and everything in between. There will be an open ended portion =
at the end of the class for further questions and discussion, and the =
class will mold itself to the needs of the folks taking it.
> =20
> This course will take a dive into every aspect of sound. My goal is to =
have you, the eager new(or old) disciple of sound, to walk away feeling =
like you have a basic grasp of how the things we hear come into being. =
The knowledge gained in this course will benefit everyone from artists =
to technicians to venue managers, even your grandma would learn =
something she can use. The class will be in three parts, the first being =
more of a lecture on the principles of sound, the second being a hands =
on to learn how we use and interact with equipment and our surroundings. =
The third is open ended, time to go over anything that confused you or =
to cover things that didn=E2=80=99t come up, whatever is helpful for the =
class. Bring your questions and your listening ears, that=E2=80=99s all =
you need.
> =20
> The Brick
> 579 Metropolitan Avenue, Brooklyn
> 6-9p lecture, 9-10p Q&A; $25-50
> bricktheater.com/sound-101-for-everyone-with-jimmy-kavetas/
> =20
> =20
> ***** LEARNING: WEDNESDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Tieknots: A Hands-On Intro on How to Count, Describe, and Tie Tieknots
> =20
> Tying tieknots can range from mandatory chore that you just want to =
get through, to a means of self-expression in a part of fashion where =
self-expression is limited. But how might one describe and share how to =
tie a particular knot? And can we use a systematic enough description to =
count how many tieknots could exist, and see whether the ones people use =
are rare or common?
> =20
> My research enumerating tieknots has been a question on Qi, has been =
heckled on NPR and helped get me a green card to the US. In this class I =
will share how counting tieknots can be done, and how the same things =
that help me count tieknots can help you remember how to tie your tie =
and broaden your repertoire.
> =20
> You do not need to bring anything - I will be bringing practice ties =
for everyone to use. If you want to use your own tie, you are of course =
welcome to.
> =20
> NYC Resistor
> 87 Third Avenue, fourth floor, Brooklyn
> 7-8p; $25
> =
eventbrite.com/e/tieknots-a-hands-on-intro-on-how-to-count-describe-and-ti=
e-tieknots-tickets-740165704547
> =20
> =20
> ***** LEARNING: WEDNESDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> World Socialist Cinema: A lecture by Masha Salazkina
> =20
> Light Industry will be hosting a talk by scholar Masha Salazkina, =
related to her recent book World Socialist Cinema. Its focus is the =
Festival of Cinemas of Asia, Africa, and Latin America, which took place =
in Tashkent, the capital of Soviet Uzbekistan, from the 1960s to the =
1980s. Salazkina uses the history of this festival as an aperture into a =
unique configuration of world cinema, one that emerged through the =
entanglement of internationalist solidarities and trans-racial =
affinities, of personal bonds and institutional connections, of =
multi-faceted artistic expressions and political commitments.
> =20
> Light Industry
> 361 Stagg Street, suite 407, Brooklyn
> 7p; $10 suggested donation
> lightindustry.org/salazkina
> =20
> =20
> ***** LEARNING: THURSDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Podcast School
> =20
> In the crowded podcast-scape, the stories that break through the noise =
often reside in the space between genres; the work that feels most alive =
borrows techniques from audio drama and memoir, from reporting and =
poetry and cinema alike.
> =20
> Chloe, accompanied by an extraordinary roster of guest instructors, =
will draw back the curtain and break down how to make innovative work =
that bends the rules. The workshop will go inside work that views sound =
as instrumental and not incidental to telling impactful stories in =
audio. It will explore work that embraces the subjective -- the =
personal, the political, the experimental. And it will examine how =
fiction can be a way to get at the truth.
> =20
> Union Docs
> 352 Onderdonk Avenue, Bushwick
> 10a-4:30p, Nov 30 - Dec 3; $385 before November 24, $425 after
> uniondocs.org/event/podcast-school-2023/
> =20
> =20
> ***** LEARNING: THURSDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Brooklyn Miniaturists
> =20
> Danny Cortes, Aaron Kinard, and Jack Giambanco have many things in =
common. They are all longtime Brooklynites, all self-taught artists =
whose passion for making miniatures took hold in just the last few =
years, and all make work that represents Brooklyn in stunningly =
intricate detail. Join them in a conversation about their craft, =
Brooklyn, and how they found themselves in this world of tiny art.
> =20
> Center for Brooklyn History
> 128 Pierrepont Street, Brooklyn
> 6:30-7:30p; $free
> =
bklynlibrary.org/calendar/cbh-talk-brooklyn-center-for-brooklyn-20231130
> =20
> =20
> ***** LEARNING: THURSDAY *****
> =20
> =20
> Drug Testing Workshop
> =20
> Curious about what you =E2=80=9Cdon=E2=80=99t know you don=E2=80=99t =
know=E2=80=9D about psychedelic safety? Interested in seeing drug =
testing firsthand?
> =20
> Join us for an evening with harm reduction educator Mohawk Kellye =
Greene, who knows better than most the dangers and concerns present out =
there in New York=E2=80=99s Psychedelic Wilds.
> =20
> Drug testing: Learn to wield a reagent kit to test ketamine, MDMA, =
LSD, and other substances with a step-by-step demonstration. Understand =
the science behind how reagents detect potential adulterants and leave =
with confidence in your ability to use your kit independently.
> =20
> Talk and Q&A: Stay informed about the latest adulterants entering the =
scene, hear stories from the front lines of harm reduction, and bring =
your toughest and most pressing questions about psychedelic safety to =
the Q+A.
> =20
> Why Attend?
> =20
> Empowerment: Equip yourself with the skills to take control of your =
own safety, and come away with your own fentanyl test strip and reagent =
kit.
> =20
> Knowledge: Gain a deep understanding of harm reduction practices, =
promoting responsible and conscious use of psychedelic substances.
> =20
> Connection: Connect with a community of like-minded individuals who =
prioritize well-being and education within the realm of psychedelics.
> =20
> Whether you're a seasoned psychonaut or new to the psychedelic scene, =
this is your chance to gain personalized insights, dispel myths, hear =
stories from the festival scene, and receive practical advice on =
harm-reduction strategies.
> =20
> (Note: no scheduled substances are permitted at the venue.)
> =20
> Brooklyn Psychedelic Society
> Social Hour Room, 110 Schermerhorn Street, Brooklyn
> 7-9p; $10
> bps.community/event-details/drug-testing-workshop-with-mohawk-greene
> =20
> =20
> ***** LEARNING: UPCOMING *****
> =20
> =20
> GLOwanus Light Installation Giveaway
> =20
> GLOwanus is a public art project designed to inform Gowanus residents =
about water quality in the Gowanus Canal. Join us in December for the =
official launch of the newly-designed GLOwanus light at our neighborhood =
giveaway event.
> =20
> Open to all ages; participants under 18 must attend with an adult. =
Light refreshments and snacks will be served.
> =20
> Designed by Brooklyn-based artists Manav Singla and Ridima Jain, =
GLOwanus is a small lantern that flashes when the Gowanus Canal is under =
a City-issued waterbody advisory -- meaning there=E2=80=99s a good =
chance Combined Sewer Overflow (CSO) has recently spilled or may soon =
spill into the Canal. When GLOwanus flashes, it=E2=80=99s signaling that =
untreated wastewater is polluting or has recently polluted the Canal. =
Using less water in your home or business, especially immediately before =
and during rainstorms, is one way to help reduce the level of CSO.
> =20
> Van Alen Institute
> 303 Bond Street, Brooklyn
> 12:30-2p; $free
> =
eventbrite.com/e/glowanus-light-installation-giveaway-tickets-760688057457=

> =20
> =20
> XXXXX HELP XXXXX
> =20
> =20
> We want to help you find help for short-term projects. Do you have a =
project, an event, or an action that needs an extra push, a few more =
people, or an extra set of hands? Please send your calls for help to: =
help]at]nonsensenyc.com.
> =20
> =20
> XXXXX NONSENSE XXXXX
> =20
> =20
> nonsense nyc is a discriminating resource for independent art, weird =
events, strange happenings, unique parties, and senseless culture in new =
york city.
> =20
> please remember you are welcome to pass nonsense along to anyone who =
needs to see it, but you do not have permission to use any of the =
listings for your commercial endeavor. if you are receiving this list as =
a forward you can sign up for yourself at nonsensenyc.com/subscribe.
> =20
> if you believe independent artists should support other independent =
artists, we accept donations. here's a link to support nonsense all year =
long: https://withfriends.co/nonsense_nyc/join. thanks.
> =20
> =20
> XXXXX END XXXXX
>=20

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">NOTE: For some navigation =
help, or an explanation for what this is all about, scroll all the way =
down to NONSENSE. You can donate to this project at =
nonsensenyc.com/special. Also: We make a lot of mistakes, especially =
with dates; you should always double check our work before you go =
out.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">XXXXX COVER ART =
XXXXX</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">herringboned =
</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">XXXXX FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 24 =
XXXXX</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Smash =
Friday</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Smash Friday is the new Black =
Friday. The day after Thanksgiving, the Smash Truck will pull up in =
front of Macy's Herald Square, and invite people into our =
polycarbonate-shielded smash enclosure to smash the living bejesus out =
of old toys, crockery, printers, appliances, and other smashables, to a =
soundtrack of thrash music, maybe some flaming brass, and the screams of =
encouragement from onlookers. Then we'll move on to Union Square and do =
the same. Is this some statement about politics or consumerism? Nah, not =
really, it's about the joy of smashing.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Macy's Herald Square, usually =
the corner of 35th Street and 7th Avenue, =
Manhattan</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">noon; =
$free</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Future =
Femmes</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">We Are the Future! is teaming =
up with OnlyFemmes for another art fair/art share and curated dance =
party at the Sultan Room. This interdisciplinary art fair/art share and =
curated dance party focused on bringing NYC's cutting-edge artists and =
creatives together to experience the intersections between multimedia =
practices, technology, sustainability and identity through their unique =
lenses. Join us for a sexy, all-night dance party featuring immersive =
art installations, DJs, live visuals, burlesque, art vendors, tarot card =
readings, body paint, and flash tattoos. With DJs Klipdagga, Vee, =
B=C3=91=C2=8Fee, J.N.R., and Senaida. Tarot readings by Techno Tarot. =
Flash tattoos by Liv. Clothing by Amor y Dinero. Herbal Treats by the =
Rooted Zodiac. We are dedicated to creating a safe and inclusive space =
for members of the BIPOC and LGBTQ+ community. =
</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Come celebrate the Owl Music =
Parlor=E2=80=99s fifth annual Hanksgiving, honoring the music of Hank =
Williams and, this year, his 100th birthday. Featuring the house band: =
Jared Engel (upright bass), Sam Talmadge (steel), Wyndham Baird =
(acoustic guitar), and Minnie Jordan (fiddle). And special guest singers =
Ali Dineen, Gustavo Rodriguez, Charlie Burnham, and Feral Foster.&nbsp; =
With hosts Rachel Swaner and Oren Bloedow. With pumpkin pie after the =
show.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Joke-e-oke: Standup Comedy =
Karaoke Game Show</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span =
style=3D"">&nbsp;</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Joke-e-oke is karaoke with =
standup comedy material, where the audience gets to be the stars in a =
three-round game show. Five contestants pick a classic standup comedy =
routine, and all the material is right there on the monitor. Three =
celebrity comedian judges rate their performances to determine the =
Joke-e-oke Champ. Hosted Harmon Leon.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Tinder =
Live</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div><span style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt">Tinder Live with Lane Moore is the critically =
acclaimed comedy show where Moore projects her dating app onto a screen, =
swipes through profiles live on stage, and the audience votes whether =
she swipes right or left, to cathartic, hilarious, and surprisingly kind =
results. With Mike Drucker and Jill Twiss.</span></span></div>

<div>&nbsp;</div>

<div><span style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt">TV Eye </span></span></div>

style=3D"font-size:12pt">1647 Weirfield Street, Ridgewood, =
Queens</span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

XXXXX</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Reverend Billy and the Stop =
Shopping Choir in Welcome to the Earthchxrch</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Each holiday season, Reverend =
Billy and the Stop Shopping Choir revisit Joe's Pub with a new hour of =
rousing, moving, and then comic songs and sermonettes on the theme of =
activism in defense of the Earth. Designer and director is Savitri =
D.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Performances of Reverend Billy =
and the Stop Shopping Choir combine activism and highly responsive =
entertainment. They are constantly changing and include songs, rituals, =
audience testimonials, and a 15-minute comic-then-serious sermon by Bill =
Talen as the energetic, charismatic revivalist preacher Reverend Billy. =
Each show is different but all are motivated by a profound imperative: =
to strengthen individual connection to the Earth, to develop pathways to =
social change and to hold financial institutions and policy makers =
accountable for their role in the Climate =
Crisis.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Joe's =
Pub</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Lonely Artists =
Salon</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">The Lonely Artists Salon, a =
space for artists to be artists, not necessarily to make art. For all =
the disillusioned young performers in NYC who are tired of having to pay =
or to wait for permission to do the things they love, this salon meets =
every other Monday to offer young performers of all disciplines the =
chance to present work, hear work from others, provide feedback and play =
fun theater games. We=E2=80=99re always excited to meet more =
people.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Hyperfocus: A Neurodivergent =
Comedy Show</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Hyperfocus is a first-class =
ticket into the inner workings of a neurodivergent brain. Come see NYC's =
best neurodivergent comedians share the wealth of their super niche =
knowledge. Previous topics included Fermentation, Do We Need Another =
Wonka Reboot? and the JFK Assassination. What will they hyperfocus on =
next? Featuring: Ronald Metellus, Dan Wickes, Blaise Vacca, and Rachel =
Kenaston. Hosted by Virginia Dickens. </span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">XXXXX TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 28 =
XXXXX</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Sounds =
Great</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">The comedy show you've grown =
to love is celebrating five years this month. It's a big five-year-old =
party, full of Sounds Greats past and present, and filled with some of =
our favorite comedians from the past five years. Join Nora and Paige as =
they run through all the moments that have prompted them to say =
=E2=80=9Csounds great," and there will be cake! This month's show will =
once again feature our signature mix of both rising and established =
performers, with a priority on queer and diverse points of view. The =
November anniversary show features: Alison Leiby, Brittany Carney, Dash =
Turner, Indigo Asim, Art Cai, Rebecca Weiser, Ryan Ciewiz, and James =
Wendt. Hosted by Nora Jefferies and Paige =
Smith-Hogan.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

*****</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">The Brick Presents: =
Slash</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Betty and Veronica have tried =
everything to cure their crippling depression and existential despair. =
Everything, that is, except acting out homoerotic =
fanfiction.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Cue a Russian doll of stories =
slashing John Lennon x Paul McCartney, Susan Sontag x Camille Paglia, =
Trotsky x Stalin, Byron x Shelley, and Kirk x Spock. =
</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">As the layers of fantasy =
multiply, the girls are left questioning what really drives their games, =
and to what end.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Slash is a two-woman comedy =
written, adapted, directed, and performed by Emily Allan and Leah =
Hennessey.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">The =
Brick</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">579 Metropolitan Avenue, =
Brooklyn</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">8p; =
$10</span></span></span></div>

2</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span =
style=3D"">Protocinema</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">A celebration of the wonderful =
and weird world of short films. Protocinema is a live screening of short =
film and video works from unknown or emerging directors. The program =
will highlight works that are evocative, eclectic, experimental, low =
budget/DIY, innovative, and ask more questions than they =
answer.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Protocinema maintains that =
shorts are a democratic medium for everyone, not just filmmakers, and =
are a unique entity separate from the traditional feature length studio =
film.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">American History =
Sex</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">How would James Madison do on =
Tinder? Which president had the best dying words? Did the Union troops =
write the original diss track? All of this and more with comedian, =
history lover, and self-lover Bobby Sheehan.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

evening of short puppet shows curated by the Boxcutter Collective. Our =

Ji, presenting the NYC premiere of their new cantastoria, You Choose: A =
Speculative Spectacle. This show is supported in part by the Puppet Slam =
Network.</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span =
style=3D"">Cryptochrome</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Cryptochrome is a sonic =
odyssey across the animal kingdom that invites audiences to imagine =
themselves in the sensory worlds of other living things. Named after a =
protein believed to be responsible for the ability to navigate using the =
Earth=E2=80=99s geomagnetic field, cryptochrome explores realms of =
perception beyond the visible. Written, directed, composed, and =
performed by Evan Silver aka Tiresias. Music direction by Tristan Allen. =
</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">The =
Cell</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

Manhattan</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Power =
Suit</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Half comedy show, half Goop =
board meeting. Power Suit is a comedy cabaret devoted to #GirlBoss =
culture. Join hosts, Mariah Oxley and Rebecca Weiser, for an evening of =
comedy, music, and drag performances inspired by famed Girl Bosses =
Gwyneth Paltrow and Elizabeth Holmes. Come laugh and commit light =
financial fraud. This month=E2=80=99s show features Indigo Asim, =
Francesca D'Uva, Alexa Loftus, and Mary Beth Barone. =
</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;">&nbsp;</div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">Club =
Cumming</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">505 East 6th Street, =
Manhattan</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span style=3D"">7:30p doors, 8p show; $12.35 =
advance, $15 door </span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
style=3D"font-family:Courier New,Courier,monospace;"><span =
style=3D"font-size:12pt"><span =
style=3D"">https://clubcummingnyc.com/schedule/2023/12/1/power-suit-with-r=
ebecca-weiser-amp-mariah-oxley</span></span></span></div>

<div class=3D"Body" style=3D"border: medium;"><span =
